item.description: Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0245; 05:35AM; 9613 S Hobart Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DjB1B8; #GramercyPark; Firefighters arrived to find a detached garage being consumed by flames. Firefighters quickly extinguished what was left of the detached structure and protected the nearby buildings being exposed to intense heat. Ultimately, it took 18 firefighters 17 minutes (5:52am) to extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E264 E57 E64 RA257 T64; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1823; 11:21PM; 13949 W Ventura Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3kfQAzh; #ShermanOaks; It took 20 firefighters 14 minutes to extinguish the flames in the 3-story commercial building. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 78; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC14 E239 E278 E288 E88 E99 RA78 T39 T78 T88; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1823; 11:07PM; 13949 W Ventura Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3kfQAzh; #ShermanOaks; Three-story bank building with fire on the second floor. Offensive mode.; FS 78; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC14 E239 E278 E288 E88 E99 RA78 T39 T78 T88; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1356; 06:01PM; 248 W 105th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3kA04JI; Broadway-Manchester; It took 24 firefighters to extinguish a fire in one upstairs unit of a two-story garden-style apartment building in 10 minutes. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E264 E57 E64 E65 RA64 RA864 T64; CH9; 14; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1356; 05:51PM; 248 W 105th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3kA04JI; Broadway-Manchester; Two-story garden-style apartment with moderate smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E264 E57 E64 E65 RA64 RA864 T64; CH9; 14; Nicholas Prange

Long Fall; INC#1269; 04:45PM; 2500 S Navy Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3dtz35b; Port of Los Angeles; An adult male fell approximately 50 feet down onto the deck of a ship (from the superstructure). Firefighters arrived on scene and found there was no confined space rescue or physical extrication required (as previously reported). Firefighters/Paramedics initiated resuscitative measures, but sadly, the man was beyond medical help. Crews determined him to be dead on scene. The details surrounding the event are currently unclear. Coast Guard has been notified and the incident will be handed over to Port Police.; FS 111; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District outside city; BC4 BC706 BT1 BT2 E238 E285 E36 E40 E5 E85 EM13 HR3 RA112 RA36 T38 T85 UR85 UR88; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0086; 02:50AM; 719 W 41st St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wqGsdV; Vermont Square; It took 34 firefighters 61 minutes to extinguish the stubborn attic fire. After beginning in offensive mode on the well-developed attic fire, crews were forced to pull back into defensive mode when the integrity of the roof became questionable. Crews fought from the exterior until flames remained only in an area that structural integrity was not compromised. Shortly after resuming offensive mode, crews were able to extinguish all flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 46; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC11 BC13 CM22 CM40 CM42 E14 E15 E211 E215 E266 E33 E46 EM11 RA46 T11 T15 T66; CH9; 15; Nicholas Prange

COMPLETE Earthquake Mode; INC#0109; 02:45AM; Citywide; Los Angeles; Your LAFD completed a strategic 470 square-mile survey of the City of Los Angeles following the 4.2M earthquake near Malibu. No damage or injuries were reported and normal operational mode has resumed. The LAFD reminds residents that, "You can't predict, but you can prepare." Tips and resources for all disasters, not just earthquakes, are available in a FREE downloadable guide found at https://www.lafd.org/safety/disaster-preparedness; Nicholas Prange

Earthquake Mode; INC#0109; 02:00AM; Citywide; Los Angeles; The USGS preliminary report is a magnitude 4.2 earthquake at 2:00 AM PST centered just off the coast of Malibu, California (16km S of Malibu). The LAFD is now in earthquake mode. All 106 neighborhood fire stations will conduct a strategic survey of their districts, examining all major areas of concern (transportation infrastructures, large places of assemblages, apartment buildings, power-lines, etc). This survey will be conducted from the ground, air and sea. Once this process is complete and reports are consolidated, assuming there is no significant damage, Earthquake mode will be complete. This process typically takes less than one hour. There are currently no initial reports of structural damage or injuries. An update will be provided once earthquake mode is complete.; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0086; 01:49AM; 119 W 41st St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3XF9LW0; Historic South-Central; One-story single-family home with fire showing from the attic.; FS 46; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E15 E215 E46 RA46 T15; CH9; 15; Nicholas Prange
